Full Job Description

ZINN Architecture + Interiors is a young and creative architecture practice in Jacksonville, FL with a wide range of clients. Our team is seeking a highly-functioning self-starter with at least 5+ years of firm experience with a strong background in conceptualizing and developing designs for high-end residential and small commercial projects.

Duties include:

Correspond with Clients politely and professionally, listen to them closely, document their requests, and be prepared to discuss their motivations and expectations with others.
Conduct Existing Conditions surveys.
Conduct preliminary zoning analysis, document findings, and be able to translate findings into 3D massing and area diagrams for use in determining project feasibility.
Understand basic Life Safety and Building Code requirements and be able to include them while designing new layouts.
Help organize and shape a project program based on a review of a project's Scope of Work, interviews with the Client(s), and a review of the existing conditions.
Work well with the project team in design charrettes to develop a project’s unique response.
Help to create diagrams or other graphic methods to communicate the basic parti to the client.
Design a ground-up or renovation floor plan for residential projects based on a defined program.
Have a grasp of Visual Composition and be open to developing strategies for improving composition creation.
Understand basic building systems and be able to coordinate and communicate with MEPS engineers.
Be familiar with basic waterproofing strategies, details, and terminology.
Work in 3D using sketchup to develop floor plan and project exterior, including roofs, and site elements.
Work in 2D using Layout to setup views, dimension, annotate, keynote, tag, reference, schedule, and callout the design.
Review drawings and create clear and concise markups. Assign markups to others but be prepared to clarify and assist with their execution.
Prepare for and attend project meetings, listen carefully, ask pertinent questions, speak confidently and with kindness, and make notes\markups. After every meeting, transcribe and clarify notes\markups and add notes to ZINN’s project management software.
Maintain an understanding of a project’s fee and report if project progress is on track with the budgeted time.
Understand the overall design and construction process including permitting and the standard phases: Predesign, Schematic Design, Design Development, Construction Documents, and Construction Administration.
Generate compelling and realistic visualizations and renderings to communicate a project’s intent, spatial characteristics, or feel.
Maintain an awareness of current and new building products, materials\finishes, methods, equipment, furniture, fixtures, and trends.
Receive client requests on everything from design updates to billing status, log them into ZINN’s project tracking system and either incorporate into your work schedule or re-assign to the appropriate co-worker.

Professional Values:

Be willing to follow ZINN’s operational standards for everything from file naming to font usage to maintain brand clarity.
Communicate clearly but efficiently both verbally and in writing.
Listen actively and pose relevant and specific questions.
Track, follow through, and complete multiple simultaneous tasks; Meet deadlines and report on ongoing task status.
Self motivate -- work independently but identify and inquire with others when directives are not clear or complete.
Maintain an open mind and accept different approaches and points of view.
Deal with others openly, honestly, and fairly.
Respond to requests and correspondence in a timely manner.
Inform others of your whereabouts if not in the office.
Maintain a tidy, organized, and clean work environment.
Present oneself professionally in speech, manner, and dress.
Maintain prompt and consistent attendance.

About ZINN Architecture + Interiors

ZINN Architecture + Interiors is a small firm with brains, talent, and heart. We believe in an all hands on deck approach and value the unique perspective of every team member. Creative, Caring, Curious – these are just some of the values at our core.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

Flexible schedule
Paid time off
Parental leave
Professional development assistance
Referral program

Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

Experience:

Architecture: 4 years (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

Report inaccurate salary
Full Job Description

Title: Architect III

Reports to: Vice President of Architecture

Location: Jacksonville, FL

Exempt/Non-Exempt: F/T Non-Exempt

Travel: < 20% Travel

Join the GMHILL team! Founded in 2004, G.M. Hill Engineering, Inc. (GMHILL) is a fast growing 8(a), woman-owned small business (WOSB) headquartered in Jacksonville, FL, and has offices in Alexandria, VA, Virginia Beach, VA, Tallahassee, FL, Panama City, FL, Beaufort, SC, and Thomasville, GA. GMHILL has a 17-year history of providing clients with a wide range of engineering, architecture, and construction services. GMHILL’s team of professionals bring the experience and proven past performance to provide full-service building solutions that few WOSB, 8(a) firms can match. We have recent Prime experience in facility assessments and building inspections; developing and reviewing D/B RFP’s; planning; architecture; engineering; construction management; general construction; design-build for federal defense and civilian agencies; state and local governments. GMHILL’s varied A/E, construction management, and design-build experience and lessons learned, provides comprehensive designs, and delivers more complete solutions that result in lower risk and better client value, higher safety ratings, and repeat business. This is an entry level position for a person who has completed a bachelor’s or master’s degree in architecture from a NAAB accredited program, has limited professional experience and strong CADD / Revit skills.

Position Summary

The position Architect III is responsible for the delivery of a completed project, including schematic design, design development, construction documents and construction administration. As an Architect with GMHILL you must be able to oversee multiple projects simultaneously and successfully lead a design team with exceptional quality, while remaining within scope, schedule, and budget. This position is fully responsible for project delivery, including responding to client needs, creating design solutions, coordinating design sub consultants, negotiating change orders, authoring construction documents, and facilitating invoicing. You may also be called on to review the drawings of other architects for an independent quality assurance review. Your expertise will devise new design solutions, and prepare or modify drawings, specifications, and monitor work of design team on your project for compliance to applicable building codes, ADA/ABA Guidelines, and GMHILL standards.

Key Tasks

Following is a general list of tasks falling into the areas of responsibility of the Architect III. It attempts to present a comprehensive, but not complete, listing of potential assignments that may be undertaken.

Perform routine to moderately difficult architectural projects with minimal supervision
Conduct programming charrettes among the project team members, end users, and key stakeholders to lead the transformation of a project from a static, complex problem to a successful, buildable plan that is within budget, scope, and schedule
Carefully prepare working drawings, calculations, specifications, basis of design narratives, schedules, and cost estimates on specific projects
Produce a well-coordinated set of construction documents
Ensure that projects meet applicable building codes, ADA guidelines, Whole Building Design Guide, and other Federal and State and Local laws
Effectively communicate with Director of Architecture, and Contracting Officers, regarding contract documents, change orders and other contract modifications, approvals, and any additional services-related to billing
Effectively coordinate and work with in-house team and outside consultants
Maintain all drawings, documents, and communications according to GMHILL filing system in format that is retrievable and efficiently accessed by team members
Deploy problem-solving skills and analysis, and report problems to the Director of Architecture, as necessary
Coordinate routine contract administration and monthly project invoicing with project administrator
Perform field activities such as observe and record existing field conditions, take photos, provide condition assessments, and verify measurements within project area
Travel to project sites (In town and out of town) for client meetings and field observations
Review shop drawings, and respond timely to RFI’s
Assume the lead Architect role on assigned projects
Use computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment to prepare design documents
May direct and supervise other Designers/Drafters activities
Coordinate work with other disciplines such as structural, mechanical, electrical, etc.
Organize, draft, and coordinate technical documents
Demonstrate capability and experience in managing and performing projects in a fast-paced environment
Coordinate with GMHILL Construction group personnel on D/B projects, when needed
Participate in proposals, presentations, interviews, and business development activities, when needed
Perform additional assignments, as directed by the Director of Architecture

Education and Training Requirements:

Registered Architect, required (Florida, Virginia, South Carolina, Georgia, preferred)
Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in Architecture from an NAAB accredited institution
Minimum 10 years’ experience in increasingly responsible architectural positions
Minimum 3 years’ experience as project architect or project manager
Federal project and task order experience (Defense and/or Civilian Agency), preferred
LEED AP BD+C, a plus
Excellent computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite

Skill and Competency Requirements:

Self-starter, highly motivated, enthusiastic, able to provide architectural rigor while operating within contractual scope, budget, and schedule requirements for project deliverables on multiple concurrent projects
Customer Service – able to personally provide high level of interactive service to targeted customer base/market, building relationships, and acting as internal company advocate
Team Orientation & Interpersonal – highly motivated, passionate, and creative team-player with ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with all levels within and external to the organization
Communication – able to effectively and persuasively express self verbally and in writing, using correct language and grammar in a professional, diplomatic, and tactful manner
Organization & Time Management – able to work independently with minimal supervision, planning, scheduling, and organizing professional schedule to complete actions within established deadlines, handling multiple priorities with strong attention to detail
Willingness to learn and adapt to change
Leadership – ability to train, develop, coach, and mentor others
Systems & Software – proficient in the use of REVIT, AutoCAD, and Microsoft Office software applications
Basic proficiency in business processes, including contractual and legal procedures
Experience in all phases of the design process from project planning and concepts through working drawings and construction administration.
Problem-solving – able to apply creative solutions to a wide variety of building projects, from renovation to new construction
Strong design review skills
Ability to work well with others under deadline situations and respond to changes in priorities
Ability to work independently, take initiative, set priorities, and see projects through to completion
Strong service orientation
Valid driver’s license and current passport
Ability to travel as needed
Satisfactory criminal background check

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Parental leave
Retirement plan
Vision insurance

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

Bonus pay

Architectural: 10 years (Preferred)

Registered Architect (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

Job details
Salary
$84,094 - $117,728 a year
Job Type
Full-time
Full Job Description

Why Mayo Clinic
Mayo Clinic is the nation's best hospital (U.S. News & World Report, 2021-2022) and ranked #1 in more specialties than any other care provider. We have a vast array of opportunities ranging from Nursing, Clinical, to Finance, IT, Administrative, Research and Support Services to name a few. Across all locations, you’ll find career opportunities that support diversity, equity and inclusion. At Mayo Clinic, we invest in you with opportunities for growth and development and our benefits and compensation package are highly competitive. We invite you to be a part of our team where you’ll discover a culture of teamwork, professionalism, mutual respect, and most importantly, a life-changing career!

Mayo Clinic offers a variety of employee benefits. For additional information please visit Mayo Clinic Benefits. Eligibility may vary.

Position description
This position is responsible for the preparation of signed and sealed construction documents for special and small projects. The candidate must thoroughly understand building construction and the construction/fabrication details associated with complex quality environments. Responsible for the recruiting and development of staff to operate and manage the Facilities Services' electronic database.

Qualifications
EDUCATION: Requires Bachelor of Science degree in Architecture or an Associate degree and professional experience of 8-10 years. A current Architectural Registration in the State of Florida; along with significant prior architectural work experience with an architectural firm specializing in health care projects required.
EXPERIENCE: Must demonstrate proficiency in Computer Aided Design and Drafting (CADD), computer operating systems, and other computer software applications. Must possess strong interpersonal skills.

Additional qualifications
COMPETENCY: Proficient with AutoCAD 2000(I) for preparation of design documents. Ability to design and prepare architectural/engineering documents. Ability to review proponent requests for compliance with institutional standards, compliance with building codes and help resolve any problems with project manager. JOB KNOWLEDGE: Must have good oral and written communication skills along with the ability to establish and meet deadlines. Must have good understanding of building mechanics, a knowledge of building materials, equipment and construction techniques, comprehensive understanding of life safety issues, building codes, and standards; ability to adapt codes to specific design conditions and solution. Must also have the ability to read and interpret construction documents, construction details, and specifications for all types of buildings. Expected to assume responsibility for maintaining personal technical competency and growth. Must be able to handle the pressure associated with heavy project load and tight time lines. ADDL CONSIDERATIONS: Must stay current with "state of the art" software. Expected to provide support to team members during all phases of a project to facilitate completion. Must maintain high quality standards. Required to establish and meet schedules, attend meetings, or visit work areas before or after normal working hours. Required to attend training/classes/seminars to maintain skills. Must maintain current architectural registration in the State of Florida and be in good standing.

Exemption status
Exempt

Compensation Detail
$84,094.40 - $117,728.00 / year

Benefits eligible
Yes

Schedule
Full Time

Hours / Pay period
40

Schedule details
Monday - Friday, General Hours 8am-5pm

Weekend schedule
Select site visits during construction or for special events.

International Assignment
No

Site description
Jacksonville is the largest city in area in the continental United States. A beautiful coastal Florida city that features excellent year-round climate, over 20 miles of beaches and outstanding outdoor recreational, cultural and family-oriented amenities. The “River City by the Sea” has an excellent school system, reasonable cost of living and a thriving business environment. Medical professionals and patients are drawn to Jacksonville by an extraordinary network of high-profile healthcare facilities. Jacksonville continues to grow as more people relocate from all over the U.S. and abroad, to see what the great River City has to offer!

Recruiter
Stephanie Dillon

EOE
As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Mayo Clinic is committed to creating an inclusive environment that values the diversity of its employees and does not discriminate against any employee or candidate. Women, minorities, veterans, people from the LGBTQ communities and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply to join our teams. Reasonable accommodations to access job openings or to apply for a job are available.

Architect - Jacksonville, FL
Halff Associates is a full service architectural and engineering firm with creative architects and engineers and experience professionals working on impactful projects and experienced at creating sustainable buildings. We offer clients a full suite of architectural and engineering services through our collaborative process that results in projects that are thoughtful engaging. Our portfolio includes corporate, government, higher education, industrial, commercial architecture projects, and more, and is continuing to expand. We are actively seeking energetic, self-motivated, and highly collaborative Architects with demonstrated capabilities in design, production, as well as verbal and written communication skills. Previous experience working in an architectural and or an architectural and engineering firm is preferred as is a strong willingness to learn and work as a team member.

Responsibilities:
Display design and graphic skills
Ensure that drawings incorporate industry standards and compliance with applicable building codes
Work both independently and in a team environment on a variety of projects and tasks
Work with senior architects, and engineers through the planning, design and production of project documents
Lead production of project documents
Interface with consultants, owner representatives, and review officials
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture, Master’s Degree in Architecture highly desirable
3-8 years’ experience
Licensed Architect in Florida preferred or ability to become licensed in Florida
Working knowledge in design and production of all phases of architectural project delivery including programming, design, design development, construction documents, and construction administration
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Excellent verbal and writing skills
Collaborative, team oriented, and readiness to learn quickly
LEED accreditation is a plus
Ability to meet fast paced project demands
Proficient with Revit (BIM)
Familiarity with Navisworks, AutoCAD, and scheduling and spreadsheet applications a plus
Experience in writing specifications a plus


Company Overview:
Halff is a mid-sized, employee-owned, diverse and multi-disciplined professional services firm. For more than 70 years, Halff has provided smarter solutions throughout the United States offering services in Architecture, Construction Services, Energy, Environmental, Geographic Information Systems, Intelligent Transportation Systems, Land and Site Development, Planning and Landscape Architecture, MEP Engineering, Public Works, Right of Way, Structural Engineering, Subsurface Utility Engineering/Utility Coordination, Surveying, Transportation, Water Resources and Water/Wastewater.
Halff has offices in the following locations:
Arkansas: Bentonville, Fort Smith, Little Rock and North Little Rock
Florida: Chipley, Jacksonville, Miramar Beach, Panama City Beach, Tallahassee, Tampa and Tavares
Louisiana: Baton Rouge and Shreveport
Oklahoma: Oklahoma City
Texas: Austin, Brownsville, Conroe, Corpus Christi, Flower Mound, Fort Worth, Frisco, Houston, Midland, McAllen, Richardson, San Antonio and Tyler
We offer excellent benefits including medical, dental, prescription, life insurance, long-term and short-term disability insurance, paid time off and holiday pay, Traditional and Roth 401(k) plans, Employee Stock Ownership Plan, Health Savings Account, 529 College Savings Plan, Flexible Spending, an Employee Assistance Plan and more.
Salary is competitive and commensurate with experience.
Halff is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status.

Full Job Description

If you are a passionate Architecture Designer looking to join a growing firm, there is an incredible opportunity that awaits in the area. This reputable Architecture and Design Firm is looking for an experienced Architecture Designer that wants to be a part of a growing and successful culture. Looking to for great mentorship, leadership, growth look no more!

Seeking an Architecture Designer with technical skills.

Assist in developing building design concepts and solutions, generating construction documents
MUST be familiar with Multifamily, Residential, Commercial
Participating in collaborative team design meetings, and occasionally working with outside consultants.
You will exercise your technical skills in preparing communication graphics, design visualizations, and preparing technical construction documents

Responsibilities:

Must be someone who is looking for career growth
Will be working with design and drawing production teams through all phases of client projects. Use experience to bring new approaches to the design process. Help our clients imagine and create what is possible.
Utilizing Revit, AutoCAD, software, design, prepare construction drawings
Utilizing Adobe Creative Suite programs, prepare communication graphics, presentations
Work collaboratively with project team members
Assist in preparing assembly, enclosure, and waterproofing details under experienced supervision
Process construction submittals, RFIs, substitution requests and shop drawings

Benefits:

Our benefits include medical, paid holidays and paid time off.
Offer employee stock ownership and annual bonus opportunities.
Offer reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associates renewals
$70-100K (negotiable depending on years of experience)
Excellent Benefit Package (401k, Health, Dental, Bonus)

Qualifications:

3-6 years of demonstrable experience as an architectural designer
Proficiency in Revit
3D rendering and visualization skills
Conceptual understanding of building codes, standards and building structures
Conceptual understanding how buildings are constructed with the ability to co-create technical details and documents that succinctly describe the project
Strong organizational, communication and interpersonal skills
Bachelor’s degree in Architecture or related field
Familiarity with LEED a plus

Full Job Description

We are looking for someone that understands the importance of high-quality documentation and specification development, works well independently as well as with a team, possesses strong organizational and communication skills, has a strong attention to detail and propensity for problem solving. If that sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Preference given to those with Multi-family, Healthcare, Mixed-use, Hospitality, and/or Retail experience.

BDG Architects has established an excellent office location at 100 North Laura St., in the middle of the vibrant and growing central core on the north bank of Downtown Jacksonville. This is an opportunity to be a key asset in BDG's growing Jacksonville office, which was established in 2021. We offer a flexible and fun work environment backed by a growing pipeline of work both in Jacksonville and beyond. We offer a competitive compensation package, commensurate with experience.

We are currently seeking candidates with approximately 6-20 years of experience with licensure to practice Architecture within an NCARB jurisdiction of the United States. An in-depth understanding of and working proficiency in Revit is required. Ambitious, collaborative, goal-oriented individuals on the path to licensure will also be considered for a role that would progress to a Project Architect upon licensure.

BDG Architects is a full-service architecture and design firm with its headquarters in Tampa, Florida. With southeast regional offices in Jacksonville, Florida, Birmingham, Alabama and Charlotte, North Carolina BDG has been in business more than 25 years, serving clients throughout Florida and the United States. We have built our reputation as being on the leading edge of our industry through design excellence, building lasting relationships, and delivering high value to our clients. BDG understands that each client has a unique set of business strategies, which we focus our services to support, creating a true partnership. Our projects are extremely diverse in terms of project type, design styles, practice areas and scale. Additional information can be found at www.BDGLLP.com.

Full Job Description
The Opportunity:
RS&H is currently seeking an Architect to join our Aviation Practice in Ft. Lauderdale, Florida.
What we do:

We design airports and aviation-related facilities throughout the US and abroad. Aviation Architecture consistently represents a complex commingling of multiple building types/ functions (civic, cultural, commercial, hospitality, office, retail, workplace, interiors, etc.) often under one roof.

Our projects are experienced by millions of people each year and can reach hundreds of millions of dollars in construction value. The clients we serve are focused on providing the best customer experience through outstanding design, technical excellence, and a desire for community.


The RS&H Design Philosophy: We believe the best buildings uplift and affirm the people they serve, embody elegant form and function, and manifest purpose, personality, and spirit.

Who we are looking for:

RS&H is actively seeking an experienced, registered Project Architect/Project Manager.
We foster, value, and reward people who are creative, self-motivated, and collegial. As an Aviation Architect with RS&H you will have the opportunity to deliver projects of various sizes and complexities. Your work will be informed and supported by in-house planners, airfield and building engineers, and environmental specialists to ensure that all aspects of any aviation facility are accounted for and integrated into the design.


This is a unique opportunity to join a team that will embrace your ideas to even better serve our great clients.

Qualifications:
Professional NAAB accredited degree in Architecture
Registered architect in good standing with the ability to obtain reciprocity
Minimum 5+ years of related experience
Thorough knowledge of architectural design, drafting, detailing, building materials, building codes, construction techniques and costs
Proven knowledge of general architecture practice including programming, site planning, civil, structural, mechanical and electrical engineering
Capable in marketing building-related services to existing and new clients
Adept at mentoring and encouraging young architects to maximize their abilities
Strong analytical, oral and written communication skills
Ability to build quick rapport and assemble quality teams
Skilled in the areas of problem identification and solving skills
Knowledge of the aviation market sector's unique challenges for planning, design and regulation is preferred
Adept in the preparation of architectural construction documents and coordination of those with building engineering disciplines
Capacity to work on multiple projects concurrently in various stages of design and construction
Review and process shop drawings, maintain and record changes on project during construction administration
Coordinate with project leadership team to develop execution plans
Review drawings, suggest revisions and work with team to update designs on those suggestion
Oversee a team of architects and engineers working on an architectural project, reporting progress to the project lead as needed

Benefits:
Holiday Pay
Paid Time Off
401K
Medical and Dental
Click Here for Full Benefits Information
If this sounds like the role for you and you're ready to join an amazing team, please apply.

#LI-KA1
The Team:
Our aviation experts are recognized, industry leaders who provide cutting-edge solutions that shape the future of aviation in four broad service areas: airfields, buildings, environmental, and planning. From large hub to small hub, commercial to private, you can help create aviation systems that serve communities around the world.
The Company:
RS&H provides fully integrated architecture, engineering, and consulting services to help clients realize their most complex facility and infrastructure projects for land, air, and space. We are committed to bringing extraordinary solutions to our clients through the promise of imagination, ingenuity, and innovation. With a tradition of excellence that began in 1941, we are consistently ranked among the nation’s top 100 design firms. We attribute our success to an unwavering commitment to our core values of: integrity, quality service, business success and valuing associates.

An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Architectural Senior Project Manager (Residential)

Jacksonville, FL

The Senior Architectural Project Manager is directly responsible for managing assigned builder accounts, projects, and teams. Participation in strategy and planning for resource allocation and product development are key responsibilities.

Highlights:

Collaborative Design Approach - The appreciation for cost effective design and lean processes is embedded in the corporate culture.
Established Client Relationships - Opportunity to step in and lead projects for existing clientele
Quality Focused - Formed in 2008, with a mission from the beginning to create high quality home designs without the high-quality price.
Hybrid Role - This position offers the ability to work a hybrid in-office (Jacksonville) 3 days/2 days from home schedule

What You’ll Do:

Initial point of contact for Central Processing, customer service, production Department, and the client for all new and existing product development.
Builder/Trade partner meetings and resolution of field issues and project status
Responsible for managing their team to meet deadlines, answer questions, solve problems, and improve the profitability of accounts.
Manage project workflow and communication across all applicable departments.

Assist with onboarding of new clients and projects to help define workflows and scheduling.
Ensure pricing standards for clients and accounts are properly applied to projects.
Track projects for completion and report status to accounting for invoicing.
Regularly review account performance and communicate with manager on status.
Responsible for the technical accuracy of construction documents for clients

Project Tracking- maintain log of work performed
Effectively track time and job status to maintain efficient workflow
Demonstrate efficient and competent use of project tracking software

Participate on committees and work on special projects as assigned

Experience and Leadership skills to focus on transfer of knowledge, development of subject matter, and solving issues surrounding building code compliance and design

Company Overview Summary
Genplant LLC is an innovative energy solutions provider focused on delivering energy solutions including optimization services, energy plants and operations and maintenance of energy systems. Our unique modular energy plant design reduces cost, improves efficiency, increases reliability, and optimizes energy production for businesses. Genplant delivers energy system solutions that generate electricity, steam, hot water and/or chilled water that can be designed, built and installed quickly, at lower cost and in higher volume than custom engineered solutions. We are looking for candidates who are self-starters and who want to join a dynamic growing organization.

Job Summary
The Commercial Architect is an integral part of the Design Department Team with responsibilities including design, engineering, and creating manufacturing and field installation drawings for projects.
Duties/Responsibilities
The Commercial Architect will successfully perform the following tasks, duties, and responsibilities:
Architectural design of modular buildings
Produces conceptual plans, renderings, and documents
Plans and programs layout of projects; coordinates and integrates engineering elements into unified designs for client review and approval
Generates design documents for permitting and construction
Generates calculations, specifications, drawings, and models in 3D or CAD software
Ensures all design work conforms to all industry standards and guidelines, including, but not limited to: IBC, ASCE, ACI, ASHRAE, ASME, OSHA, NFPA, ADA
Coordinates work with other disciplines such as architectural, mechanical, electrical, etc.
Prepares and maintains commission records of site observations, testing processes, and checklists
Assists in research and coordination of materials and products for project specifications
Contributes to the continued growth of the design checklist, leading to improvement of design standards
Interfaces with vendors, customers, and contractors. Reviews vendor quotes and specifications.
Works with departmental managers to meet Company and departmental goals and objectives
Assists Sales and Project Development teams in new project proposals and new project costs estimates
Researches new products and design methods to innovate current designs
*Other duties as required in support of the department and the Company*
Qualifications
The Commercial Architect should possess the following skills, characteristics, and abilities:
Experience in designing commercial structures. Experience in modular design a plus.
Ability to read, interpret, utilize, and train on manuals, schematics, and control circuits related to CHP
Technical aptitude with knowledge of codes and an ability to handle multiple tasks and assignments
Capable and experienced in managing and performing projects in a fast-paced environment
Excellent customer service skills
Detail-oriented and highly organized with the ability to handle multiple tasks and assignments
Strong computer skills; knowledge of and proficiency in common Office applications
Expert at 2D and 3D CAD
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Architecture or related field
3+ years of related experience
Knowledge of building codes, zoning regulations, building construction, building systems, and site requirements
Proficiency in Revit, AutoCAD, Photoshop, and Microsoft Office suite is required
Architectural license a plus

Additional Requirements
Minimal travel expected for this position
Bilingual English/Spanish a plus

Description:

ABOUT NOVUS ARCHITECTS

Novus Architects is a full-service architecture firm with offices in Charleston, SC, Atlanta, GA, Asheville, NC, Charlotte, NC, Jacksonville, FL and Springline Architects in St. Thomas, USVI. Novus is committed to quality in both their work and relationships, and has an innovative approach to solution-based design and project management that sets them apart as a firm.

The Novus portfolio of work is a reflection of their experience in many building sectors including Healthcare, K-12, Higher Ed, Financial, Municipal, Hospitality, Multi-Family, Recreation, Commercial, and Worship. With a staff that has a diverse set of skills in Architecture, Interior Design, Project Management, FFE Coordination, Environmental Graphics and Construction Administration, Novus has positioned themselves as an established design firm with both regional and national clients.

TEAM NOVUS

As a set of individuals with diverse talents, we come together to make up a team that challenges itself creatively every day. Thru thoughtful collaboration, respect, and mentorship, we continue to build an engaging work environment and a company culture we can’t help but celebrate. We want you to bring your ideas and passion to the table and always encourage innovation that leads to creative solutions.

It’s important to us to foster our staff’s growth through leadership training, professional certifications, continuing education, and conference participation. Our staff finds reward in seeing this growth within themselves, their peers, and the company as a whole-a defining aspect of the understanding we have that our greatest asset is our employees.

The Successful Candidate will:

Be responsible for the coordination of all project efforts, administrative and technical, to ensure the most efficient and cost-effective execution of assigned projects.
Successfully manage a project from concept through completion while simultaneously managing staff and client relationships.
This Job has the option of working remotely or in an office.

Duties/Responsibilities:

Supervisory

Responsible for managing 2 or more direct reports. Will manage 2 or more projects concurrently.
Manage a team remotely using Microsoft Teams and Bluebeam sessions.

Architectural

Be a highly productive architect with demonstrated skills in conceptualizing and adapting design templates that will enable efficient completion of sequential projects.
Complete a project from beginning to end in Revit, with little direction, by reviewing “go by” drawing sets, including modeling existing conditions from field survey information.
Review drawings, generate redlines and review to ensure redlines are completed.
Review building code to ensure compliance to code requirements.
Coordinate with consultants, jurisdictions, and client to ensure client needs are met.
Coordinate with team for Permitting, Bidding, and Construction Administration to ensure project success.
Understand and coordinate with existing conditions for renovation projects.

Project Management

Manage multiple small/medium projects, coordinates all aspects of assigned projects, and estimates scope of work.
Ensure project deadlines are met.
Responsible for the coordination of all project efforts, administrative and technical, to ensure the most efficient and cost-effective execution of assigned projects.
Understand project profitability.
Make effective use of support staff.
Requirements:
Clear, effective communication, problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a strong drive to see results that will ensure you retain highly satisfied clients.
Exceptional communication skills for working directly with consultants, jurisdictions, and general contractors.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills space planning.
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to work on tight deadlines with excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
Have strong process-management skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to function well in a high-paced environment.
Proficient with Revit, Microsoft Office Suite, and Bluebeam.
Documentable experience training and leading junior level staff.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part as a team.

Education and Experience:

10 or more years of experience in Architecture.
Professional degree in Architecture.
Licensure required.

Full Job Description

Are you ready to move your career forward, and start the BEST job of your life? Haskell is committed to providing you with the resources to help you grow and discover your potential. We promote an environment that encourages innovative ideas and allows you to develop the best “how” to get the job done.

The Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) Group at Haskell supports core markets throughout the U.S., as well as Mexico and the Asia Pacific Region. Providing architecture, engineering, and construction for over 55 years in the food and beverage, consumer products, and beer, wine, and spirits markets, we work closely with many Fortune 500 companies providing our industry knowledge and expertise. Our CPG team is a melting pot of industry-leading experts and diverse, knowledgeable and experienced team members who work together to provide the best solutions to our clients. By joining the CPG team, you will become a part of a close-knit family ready to support each other and our clients. We offer a unique opportunity to build your skills, provide knowledge and create things that matter.

In this role, you will be responsible for the production of innovative and appropriately cost-effective, designs, drawings, and specifications for assigned projects. Further, you will maintain a professional registration and sign/seal documents prepared under your supervision. You must have experience with REVIT. Experience as an Architect within the Design/Build industry is highly preferred.

Job Responsibilities:

Conceptual Design
Utilizes innovation in design and methods
Develops design concepts, recommends systems, produces pricing and proposal documents, and outlines specifications
Researches and is responsible for discipline design compliance with proposal/client criteria
Establish a Discipline basis for design
Detailed Design
Analysis Ability
Researches, and documents and is responsible for discipline design compliance with all applicable codes, ordinances, standards, and regulations
Designing for Safety incorporated into drawings
Detailing
Comply with the QIP
Uses Haskell standards and procedures
Coordinates work with other disciplines, including outside consultants as applicable. Performs interdisciplinary coordination checks to minimize deficiencies, errors, and omissions in drawings and specifications
Leads the production of well-organized, finished drawings of good appearance, accuracy, clarity, and correctness
Construction Documents
Signs and seals design documents when assigned as Professional of Record
Construction Support
Reviews applicable shop drawings and submittal data for compliance with construction documents
Advises and assists Construction Project Managers, Superintendents, and Subcontractors in the interpretation and clarification of construction documents
Participates in construction observation to monitor compliance with design intent, construction drawings, and specifications. Prepares inspection reports and punch lists
Provides solutions to field problems, responds to RFI, and prepares field orders and addenda
Leads production and archiving of record drawings and specifications
Planning/Scheduling
Projects, monitors, and informs design manager of workload status of project discipline staff
Participates in project strategy meetings
Participates in the creation of overall key date schedule, including permitting schedule
Creates discipline work plan for assigned projects
Profitability
Prepares man-hour estimate for discipline work
Assists the Design Manager in monitoring costs of discipline-related outside consultants
Participates in team review to assure discipline scope is covered in project budgets, estimates, and subcontractor bids
Project Management
Directs technical efforts of discipline staff assigned to the project
Monitors discipline adherence to strategy, key date schedule, and work plan
Assists in coordinating information with and monitoring discipline-related outside consultants
Monitors workload status; advises design manager
Prepares meeting minutes and other communications in coordination with the design manager
Mentoring assigned staff

Education/Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Architecture from an accredited college or university
Project Architect I: 3-5 years of typical minimum discipline experience
Project Architect II: 5-8 years of typical minimum discipline experience

Specific Knowledge, Skills, License, Certifications:

Licensed Professional Architect, preferred
Knowledgeable in A/E technology and software. (ACAD, Revit, BIM)
Discipline production software proficiency
Intermediate skills in Microsoft Office

Environmental Factors and/or Physical Requirements:

While performing the duties of this job, this position is required to have ordinary ambulatory skills sufficient to visit other locations; and the ability to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, and manipulate (lift, carry, move) light to medium weights of 10-50 pounds. Requires good hand-eye coordination, and arm, hand and finger dexterity, including the ability to grasp, and visual acuity to use a keyboard, operate equipment and read application/form information. The associate frequently is required to sit, reach with hands and arms, talk, and hear.

Manages drawing development, including detailing, quality control, and overseeing drawing support staff
Produces construction documents
Evaluates AHJ code compliance
Facilitates project scheduling and staﬃng
Attends coordination and construction meetings and prepares ﬁeld reports
Construction Administration Experience: Site observation, answers RFI's, and prepares change bulletins
Directs issue resolution and enhances project quality in reporting to internal and external stakeholders
Contributes to business development by establishing conﬁdence with clients

Preferred Qualifications and Skills:

Bachelor's degree in Architecture at an accredited university
9+ years of architecture experience
Professional registration
Ability to prioritize and concurrently service multiple projects
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Effective problem solving and interpersonal skills and the ability to interface with all clients and employees
Interacts well with other disciplines and clients in a manner that builds productive relationships
Proﬁcient with Revit
Desire to grow team professionals through education and mentoring
Ability to balance the needs of projects with corporate goals
IND

What You'll Need

Essential Responsibilities:

Develops and presents lead technical viewpoint on projects and ensures HNTB systems are used to deliver the design in a standardized manner.
Ensures that a technical solution consistent with the program and design is properly developed and produced. Integrates quality control measures during all phases of design.
Serves as a subject matter expert on architectural projects of small to medium size and assists on larger projects.
Works closely with the project designer and manager in planning and implementing all work processes in consideration of budgets and schedules. Work includes preparing work plans, estimating hours to complete tasks, developing project reports, managing consultant team members (including coordination and incorporation of all work products) and reviewing invoices.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Architecture
5 years related experience
Revit skills

Description:

About Novus Architects

Novus Architects is a full-service architecture firm with offices in Charleston, SC, Atlanta, GA, Asheville, NC, Charlotte, NC, Jacksonville, FL, and Springline Architects, St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands. We are committed to quality in both our work and relationships, and have an innovative approach to solution-based design and project management that sets us apart as a firm.

The Novus portfolio is a reflection of our experience in many building sectors including Healthcare, K-12 Education, Higher Education, Financial, Municipal, Hospitality, Multi-Family, Recreation, Commercial, Worship, Residential and Industrial. With a staff equipped with a diverse skillset in Architecture, Interior Design, Project Management, FFE Coordination, Building Information Modeling (BIM), Environmental Graphics, and Construction Administration, we have positioned ourselves as an established design firm with national reach.

Team Novus

As a set of individuals with diverse talents, we come together to form a team that challenges itself creatively every day. Through thoughtful collaboration, respect, and mentorship we continue to build an engaging work environment and a company culture reflective of our values. We want you to bring your ideas and passion to the table and always encourage innovation that leads to creative solutions.

It is important to us as a firm to foster our team members’ growth through leadership training, professional certifications, continuing education, conference participation, and personalized mentorship to help along the way. Our staff celebrates seeing this growth within themselves, their peers, and the firm as a whole. This collaboration and encouragement of growth is a defining aspect of the understanding we have that our greatest asset is our employees.

We are seeking a tech-savvy individual who wants to begin a career in architecture. The ideal candidate will be capable of working towards licensing within a few years and will be motivated to work effectively as a member of a team.

The Successful Candidate will:

Be fully knowledgeable in all conventional aspects of architecture. Performing basic level architectural assignments to independently performing a variety of assignments requiring skills in all conventional aspects of architectural designs for projects of moderate size and complexity.

Duties/Responsibilities:

Performs design layouts and features, analyses of design, planning and occupancy studies, and limited design layouts.
Responsible for producing Permit Drawing sets (Schematic Design thru Construction Documentation) using Revit.
Responsible for researching, compiling, and recording information for assigned project work.
Prepares project specifications, compiling and analyzing relevant data.
Reviews completed reports, plans estimate, and calculations.
Ensuring project deadlines are met.
Undertaking project tasks as required.
Responsible for communicating and coordinating projects with consultants.
Requirements:
Exceptional verbal, written and presentation skills.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part as a team.
Ability to work on tight deadlines.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, Revit, AutoCAD and other software.

Education and Experience:

1 to 5 years of experience in Architecture.
Professional degree in Architecture.

We're seeking candidates for a Project Manager

PROJECT MANAGER JOB DESCRIPTION

Places that Rock! Group 4 Design was recently named one of the best places to work in Jacksonville. We are a multi-discipline design firm with an emphasis on amenity, assisted living and multi-family architecture. We strive to bring new ideas and philosophies to these established markets with creative and innovative solutions. We pride ourselves on having energetic and passionate project architects and designers and are looking to add new team members.

We are now looking to add a motivated unlicensed/licensed architect or experienced project manager to join our creative and social work environment. Experience of 5-10+ years is required with a solid understanding of project and client management, consultant coordination, constructibility of wood, steel, masonry detailing, and team leadership. All candidates must have the knowledge of AutoCAD and Revit, the ability to establish and maintain schedules and self-perform project construction administration/site observations.

READY TO APPLY? HERE'S HOW:

Email your resume to kkovacocy@g4designinc.com.

Have questions about the position? Call our office at 904-353-5900.

Prosser (www.prosser.com), a PRIME AE Group company, an integrated planning and engineering firm supporting clients in several diverse markets including the Department of Defense, Transportation, Healthcare, Higher Education, Commercial, Retail, and Residential, is seeking a Senior Architect | Project Manager for our Jacksonville, FL.


In joining with PRIME AE Group, Inc. (www.primeeng.com), Prosser has become part of a multi-faceted and rapidly growing architectural and engineering firm with 19 office locations and over 475+ employees throughout the Midwest, Mid-Atlantic, and Southeast and Northeast areas.


Our Architecture Group focuses on projects in the fields of:

Large Commercial / Public Sector
Federal | Department of Defense | Military
Community | Municipal projects (civic centers, libraries, government buildings, recreation)
Education (higher education and K-12)
Industrial
Justice
Residential
Workplace
Hospitality
Healthcare
Historic Restoration
Churches


PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Develops design and construction documents, facilitates charrettes, develops studies and reports, field assessments, and specification development.
Collaboration with PRIME AE’s inter-office divisions – MEP, Structural Engineering, Civil/Landscape – as well as external subconsultants.
Plans and supervises the preparation of construction documents and other deliverables for projects according to client goals, needs, and budgets.
Responsible for coordination of design disciplines, both in-house and outside consultants.
Conducts periodic on-site observation of work during construction to monitor compliance with Detailed Design Documents.
May prepare client project presentations, studies, and reports.
Utilizes computer-assisted design software and equipment to prepare project designs and plans – specifically Revit.
May direct activities of workers engaged in preparing drawings and specification documents for the Conceptual Design Phase, Schematic Design Phase, and/or the Detailed Design Phase of a project.


TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE

Professional Architecture Degree from an accredited school
Registered Architect preferred.
LEED Accredited Professional preferred
5 years' experience as a Project Manager preferred.
Experienced in all phases of project design, construction documentation and construction materials.
Strong interpersonal skills, verbal, listening and written communication, including client presentations.
Experience with coordination of multiple design disciplines required for developing complete documents.
Proficient in Revit and experience with AutoCAD.
Strong knowledge base of building codes, standards, building structures, and engineering systems.
Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills.


PRIME AE Group is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Full Job Description

PRIME AE Group, Inc. (www.primeeng.com), a multi-faceted and rapidly growing architectural and engineering firm with 19 office locations and over 475+ employees throughout the Midwest, Mid-Atlantic, and Southeast and Northeast areas, is seeking a Team Leader and Project Manager for our Building Envelope Team. Preferably this role will be housed in one of our Florida offices (Pensacola or Jacksonville); however, it can also be housed in our Baltimore, Columbus or Akron offices as well.

This licensed Architect or Structural Engineer will have overall project management responsibility for both routine and complex projects. The Project Manager (Architect or Engineer) is the primary point of contact for the client and is responsible for scheduling, budgeting, and design of the project. The Project Manager supervises and coordinates the activities of all internal and external team members. The Project Manager works collaboratively with business development, marketing, and administration to achieve the goals of the firm.


Primary Responsibilities

Coordinate and supervise the project team:

Communicate task assignments and expectations to each team member.
Monitor team members' efficiency and respond to changes in team staffing requirements.
Direct and coordinate consultants.
Mentor and provide guidance to less experienced staff.
Provide performance review input to the office director for project team members.


Work to achieve client’s and firm's goals within the constraints of the budget and schedule:

Establish and adhere to project budget, schedule, and milestones.
Conduct meetings and communicate regularly with clients to provide design guidance and report on project progress.
Research building materials and systems and review selections with the project team.
Implement code review and incorporate code requirements.
Establish appropriate level of detailing based on project parameters.
Prepare, review, and coordinate drawings, specifications, and other project deliverables.
Work closely with the project team to obtain project information and see that drawings are accurate and complete.
Assist clients in review of construction budget and construction contract.
Review shop drawings, submittals, RFIs, and change orders.
Perform or assign staff to perform site visits and conduct project meetings during construction.
Document meetings, correspondence, and other key project information.


Work collaboratively with other departments for the benefit of the firm:

Inform office director or supervisor of opportunities or pitfalls that may affect project budgets, schedules, or profitability.
Work with business development and marketing to prepare fee estimates and establish the scope of services for proposals.
Report project progress for invoicing.
Work with the accounting department to assist in collection of outstanding invoices.
File and organize documents in conformance with company standards.


Other Duties and Expectations

Actively seek experience and continuing education to fulfill requirements for licensure.
Participate in marketing and project-related activities and presentations.
Participate and seek leadership roles in professional/community organizations and activities.
Write and publish white papers and articles on technical topics.
Attend and speak at conferences and participate in other networking and professional development opportunities.
Demonstrate organizational skills.
Be self-motivated regarding office projects and the office environment.


Required Education and Experience

A Registered Architect or Engineer (PE) is strongly preferred.
First professional degree from an accredited architectural or engineering program AND
6+ years' of architectural or engineering experience AND
2+ years' of building envelope, consultation experience OR
Equivalent combination of academic and professional experience.
Desire to be trained and pass certifications to become a Registered Roof Consultant (RRC) or Registered Exterior Wall Consultant (REWC), or someone seeking or currently in possession of these certifications.


Required Qualifications

Project Manager: architectural graduates should be enrolled in the IDP (Intern Development Program); engineering graduates should have passed the FE (Fundamentals in Engineering) exam.
Project Architect/Engineer: license to practice architecture or engineering.
Excellent communication and writing skills.
Proficiency in computer software applications (AutoCAD, Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Project).
Willingness to work on roofs and facades utilizing contractor's staging, scaffolding, and aerial lifts.


Demonstrated ability to:

Skillfully perform all project management responsibilities.
Manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet strict deadlines.
Work independently with a minimum level of supervision.


PRIME AE Group is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
